contentrichtext.text: {{Wiktionary}} '''Triple''', a [[Doublet (linguistics)|doublet]] of "[[treble]]" or "threefold" (from Latin ''triplus'', "triple"; cf. "double" from ''duplus''), is used in several contexts: ==Sports== * [[Triple (baseball)]], a three-base hit * A basketball [[three-point field goal]] * In [[bowling terms]], three strikes in a row * [[Triple jump]], a track and field sport ** also, a [[figure skating jump]] * In cycling, a [[crankset]] with three chainrings ==Places== * [[Triple Islands]], an uninhabited island group in Nunavut, Canada * [[Triple Island]], British Columbia, Canada * [[Triple Falls (disambiguation)]], two waterfalls in the United States * [[Triple Glaciers]], in Grand Teton National Park, Wyoming * [[Triple Crossing]], Richmond, Virginia, believed to be the only place in North America where three Class I railroads cross * [[Triple Bridge]], a stone arch bridge in Ljubljana, Slovenia ==Transportation== * [[Triple Island Lightstation]], Canada * [[Kawasaki triple]], a Japanese motorcycle produced between 1969 to 1980 * [[Triumph Triple]], a motorcycle engine credited with saving the Triumph Motorcycle Company * A [[straight-three engine]] * A [[semi-truck]] with three trailers ==Science and technology== * [[Triple (mathematics)]] (3-tuple), a list or sequence with three elements * [[Triple (category theory)]], a construction in algebraic topology * The atomic data entity in the [[Resource Description Framework]] ==Other uses== * [[Triple metre]], a musical metre characterized by a primary division of three beats to the bar * [[Triple (novel)|''Triple'' (novel)]], by Ken Follett * [[Triples (cereal)]], a breakfast cereal made by General Mills in the 1990s * A method of [[Change ringing]] of bells ==See also== * [[Triple point]], in thermodynamics, the temperature and pressure at which three states of matter can co-exist * [[Treble (disambiguation)]] * [[Triplet (disambiguation)]] * [[Tripel]], a style of beer {{Disambiguation|geo}}
